thread.title: Sean Spicer Defends Republicans Against Accusations Of Sluggish Performance
thread.title_full: Sean Spicer Defends Republicans Against Accusations Of Sluggish Performance

author: Andrew Kerr
title: Sean Spicer Defends Republicans Against Accusations Of Sluggish Performance
text:
Sean Spicer Defends Republicans Against Accusations Of Sluggish Performance "... sued for fraud." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer defended President Donald Trump and the Republican party for their pace on repealing and replacing Obamacare, saying the president “wants to do it right.” 
Matt Drudge of the Drudge Report suggested in a Tuesday morning tweet that the Republican party “should be sued for fraud” for stalling on key campaign promises like tax reform and repealing Obamacare. Republican party should be sued for fraud. NO discussion of tax cuts now. Just lots of crazy. Back to basics, guys! pic.twitter.com/5uHIg8klq6 
— MATT DRUDGE (@DRUDGE) February 8, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below 
In a another tweet that has since been deleted, Drudge also questioned why the Trump has failed to sign an executive order abolishing the Obamacare tax penalty. 
Drudge has frequently criticized Republican leadership in recent years, including House Speaker Paul Ryan and others. 
When asked to respond to Drudge’s criticisms, Spicer made clear that there’s “no question the president is committed” to repealing and replacing Obamacare. Advertisement - story continues below 
“I think it’s a mammoth thing to repeal and replace,” Spicer said. “It’s a big bill. It got jammed through, and it was very sweeping. We are talking about one-fifth of our our economy.” 
“We can either do it quickly as the Democrats did, and end up with a monstrosity, where premiums go up an access is limited, or we can do it right,” Spicer explained. 
Spicer stressed the importance of drafting quality legislation that achieves the goals it seeks to accomplish, while also reassuring supporters the president is committed to repealing Obamacare as soon as possible. Advertisement - story continues below
